main event: Airmen at Erding Air Depot, Germany, spotted a silver-colored unidentified flying object on 29 October 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed gliding at a steady speed of about 400-500 MPH at an altitude of 6,000 to 7,500 feet., The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds and no sound was detected., It was described as circular in shape and approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter., Multiple witnesses, including officers, reported similar appearances and characteristics of the object., The weather conditions indicated clear visibility with no known meteorological phenomena present.
witness description: officers on duty and airmen stationed at the base
